intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris nanella, commonly known as the narrow-leafed common groundsel, is a small flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, narrow, ovate leaves with a hairy surface, and it produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, heart-shaped silique, a characteristic feature of the genus Capsella. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is widespread across temperate regions.
